summary: ON MORE THAN ONE OCCASION I HAVE LOST STEERING CONTROL WHILE TURNING RIGHT AT LOW SPEED. THE STEERING WHEEL SEEMS TO LOCK UP FOR ONE TO TWO SECONDS MAKING IT IMPOSSIBLE TO TURN RIGHT.   1.  IN TURNING LANE ON CITY STREET TURNING RIGHT ONTO SIDE STREET. FROM STATIONARY POSITION I PRESSED ON THE GAS TO TURN RIGHT AND CROSS TRAFFIC. STEERING LOCKED UP AND TRUCK WOULD NOT TURN RIGHT. IN ABOUT A SECOND OR SO THE STEERING FREED AND I WAS ABLE TO CONTINUE ON  2. AT A DRIVE THROUGH CAR WAS IN STATIONARY POSITION.  AT THE END OF WASH AND DRY OUT TRUCK IN DRIVE AND PROCEEDED TO TURN RIGHT. STEERING LOCKED UP AND I WAS UNABLE TO TURN RIGHT FOR ABOUT A SECOND OR SO. THEN STEERING FREED AND I WAS ABLE TO PROCEED.   3. AT STOP LIGHT STATIONARY MAKING A RIGHT HAND TURN PRESSED ON GAS AND STEERING LOCKED UP FOR A SECOND OR SO. THEN STEERING FREED AND I WAS ABLE TO PROCEED.
